SENT.plain: Mixed lesion of Restrictive Cardiomyopathy and Constrictive Pericarditis is a rarely reported clinical entity which poses a diagnostic and therapeutic enigma to physicians
The management of both conditions differs markedly
Restrictive Cardiomyopathy is managed either conservatively or cardiac transplant may be offered
On the other hand, Constrictive Pericarditis can be surgically treated by pericardiectomy
We report a rare case of decompensated heart failure presenting with mixed features of both constrictive and restrictive cardiomyopathy
